criteria: The algorithm correctly calculates the nth Fibonacci number.
The function handles edge cases (e.g., n = 0, n = 1) correctly.
Code is well-structured and easy to read.
Variable names are descriptive and follow a consistent naming convention.
Comments are provided to explain the purpose of each function or section of code.
The algorithm has an optimal time complexity (O(n)) for calculating Fibonacci numbers.
Proper use of memoization or dynamic programming is implemented, if applicable.
Code follows best practices for error handling and input validation.
Memory management is proper and does not lead to memory leaks.
The code uses system resources efficiently, such as file I/O and memory allocation.
